scenario:
Colgate-Palmolive (CL) shares fell 4.6% after missing top-line revenue expectations in its fourth-quarter earnings report. Revenue was down 0.1% to $4.94 billion, missing the consensus of $4.99 billion due to a strong dollar. Organic sales rose 4.3%, with volume sales up 2.5% and pricing up 1.8%. The company's gross margin rose 70 basis points to 60.3%. Base business earnings per share rose to $0.91, topping expectations at $0.89. 

The company guided for flat revenue in fiscal 2025 due to mid-single-digit negative impact from currency exchange, but expects organic sales to be within its 3-5% target range. It also forecast gross profit margin expansion and low- to mid-single-digit adjusted earnings-per-share growth.
